Help us boldly shape retail in Canada   Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.  It’s an exciting time to be in Loyalty here at Canadian Tire Corporation!. Join our team and you will be a part of Canada’s oldest loyalty rewards program that is striving to be the most innovative as well. Triangle Rewards members collect electronic Canadian Tire ‘Money’ and get access to exclusive benefits such as personalized offers, weekly flyer bonuses and events. The Triangle Rewards program is leveraging technology to better understand customers and build relationships by offering a more personalized experience. Join us and help lead the transformation of Canada’s most iconic loyalty program!  The role of Senior Analyst, Loyalty is responsible for all areas of measurement for the Triangle Rewards loyalty program. Specifically, the responsibilities of the role include tracking key program health metrics (issuance, active customers, etc.), conducting post campaign analysis, and monitoring loyalty channel performance. In addition, the Senior Analyst, Loyalty will be tasked with operationalizing and automating key loyalty data to allow for real time reporting (Ex: Dashboard creation). In addition to leading the day to day management of loyalty data, the role requires a keen eye for opportunity identification and the ability to translate insights into future program strategies. In the role, the Senior Analyst, Loyalty will work closely with the Loyalty Manager and Senior Loyalty Consultant to develop future program strategies that result in increased customer engagement and overall program growth.            Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. The Position  The Brand Advocate Analyst for assigned supplier brand is responsible for creating and executing the supplier project strategy, generating and presenting analytical data, and providing insightful digital content findings to propel the brand’s conversion online. The Brand Advocate Analyst is also responsible for developing strong supplier relationships, executing against quarterly action plans and effectively communicating successes / progress within the account. The Brand Advocate program is a unique vendor funded model that provides brands the ability to leverage dedicated in-house Home Depot Canada associates to perform and expedite white-glove content enrichment initiatives.    EXECUTE PROJECT STRATEGY Complete data maintenance tasks in digital content systems to drive account strategy Produce and track weekly, monthly and quarterly supplier specific status reports to communicate project status and track key metrics including add to cart, conversion rate, sales, views, enrichment, SEO Ranking against baseline PRESENTATION DEVELOPMENT Build power point decks to effectively communicate during engagement (e.g. kick-off, weekly, monthly, quarterly etc.) Communicate effectively and confidently with suppliers and internal leadership GENERATE ANALYTICAL REPORTING Utilize test-control experimental group testing, heat mapping and other metrics to enhance prioritized supplier's presence on PIPs Leverage online reviews and Q&A to drive improvements on supplier product pages CATEGORY INSIGHTS & STRATEGY Collaborate with merchant to gain understanding of the supplier and the line of business Analyze supplier and department specific data in order explain trends, impacts and inform strategy Build category knowledge to assist in identifying items and enrichments to prioritize in project work Leverage online reviews and Q&A to drive improvements on supplier product pages Promote supplier adoption for Q&A and future user-generated content programs ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS: Data analysis Experience in Ecommerce, data management, process analysis and improvement Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks Outstanding written and verbal communication skills Effective interpersonal and problem solving skills    Must fulfill minimum time-in-position (1 year) and performance management code requirements (M+, Meets expectation, Consistently demonstrates). Strong decision making and problem solving skills Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Access Strong organizational, analytical and customer service skills Positive, upbeat, can-do, professional and responsible attitude, independent and self-directed yet also team oriented Influential; practiced in negotiating with others in ways that result in win-win outcomes

Company Description  null Job Description  The PRESTO program ("PRESTO Program") is an automated fare collection system that has established a single farecard using smartcard technology allowing cardholders access to transit travel throughout the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area (GTHA) and Ottawa. The PRESTO Program is currently extending its capabilities to supply initial device and support for The Toronto Transit Commission ("TTC"), a service provider supporting transit demand for Greater Toronto Area (GTA), Ontario.  The PRESTO system is been implemented at the TTC. The program is being rolled-out in phases with activity divided into four functional categories: 1 - Subway Operations involving customer interaction and interfaces withion the TTC subway environemnt; 2 - Surface Operations involving customer interaction and interfaces on all TTC streetcars, buses and Wheel-Trans, and off-board transit stops; 3) Website and back-office services including financial reconciliation; 4) Managed Services which includes system performance management and the system operations and maintenance support functions  The majority of the systems equipment is now installed and available for customer use and the adoption and transition rates for customer to the new system is increasing. There is an increased need to further develop, implement and manage the ongoing system and related support activites. It is important that expert technical assistance is available to various farecard projects and operational activities.      and various Internal/External requirements    This work will may require some coordination of work for over-night work crews. This will involve some work on varied shifts and the use of a personal vehicle.     Additional Information  null

Senior Analyst, Health Economics  Location: Canada, US (flexible location)  This is an opportunity to work for ICON Global HTA, Health Economics, Reimbursement and Outcomes (GHTA-HERO), a division of ICON plc, an international clinical research organisation headquartered in Dublin, Ireland. Our Global HTA-HERO group has offices in UK, Stockholm (Sweden), Nanterre (France), New York and Boston (USA), Vancouver (Canada) and Bangalore (India). We are respected globally for the quality and innovation of our work, undertaking consultancy projects for international clients in both the pharmaceutical and medical device sectors.  ICON GHTA-HERO is currently seeking to appoint a Senior Analyst to join its Global team. This team is highly respected in the field of health economics and health technology assessment (HTA) for quality and innovation, undertaking consultancy projects for international clients in both the pharmaceutical and medical device sectors.  The Senior Analyst will be required to contribute to all aspects of the group's work and, in particular to develop their skills in economic modelling, evidence synthesis, including systematic and targeted literature reviews, and network meta-analyses/indirect comparisons. In return the candidate will receive extensive on the job training from our senior scientists as well as the opportunity to attend external technical training courses and to attend and present at major international conferences. We are dedicated to furthering our research and development in the field of Health Economics and HTA and, as such, promote publication of work undertaken. The candidate recruited for the role will be actively encouraged to publish work they contribute to.

The Brookfield Infrastructure Group is one of Brookfield Asset Management’s primary operating groups. The Infrastructure Group operates and manages assets owned through its private funds and public listed entity, Brookfield Infrastructure Partners (BIP). Our portfolio of assets primarily spans the utilities, transport, energy and communication infrastructure sectors, located in North and South America, Europe and Asia Pacific.    The will join the Portfolio Management team within the Infrastructure business group, reporting directly to the Manager. The objective of the team is to partner effectively with each of our operating businesses and internal stakeholders to drive performance, generate value, and act as a trusted resource on asset management matters.  The will be responsible for assisting with developing, maintaining, and overseeing Brookfield Infrastructure's enterprise risk management, and compliance programs across our portfolio of global assets and to ensure that risks across the businesses are mitigated to an acceptable level. You will also assist in overseeing the portfolio management operations for the group, including key elements of our asset management framework. In addition, you will work closely with the Manager, Portfolio Management to identify emerging issues arising from the rapid growth of the business and developing long term solutions, further strengthening the foundation to support the continued growth of the business. The Senior Analyst will also support onboarding new assets into Brookfield's operations processes. This role provides the foundation, guidance and exposure towards a successful and challenging career in Finance. The successful candidate will be a self-starter that enjoys working in a fast-paced environment, has excellent interpersonal skills, possesses a high degree of intellectual curiosity and has a strong foundation in analytical thinking. Job Description  If you enjoy working in a fast-paced, ever-changing and exciting startup environment, then this is the job for you! The Technical Business Analyst will work closely with our product, tech, sales and operations teams to analyze and identify internal and external business requirements to maximize the value of the GoMaterials online platform. You'll play a pivotal role in growing our business from day 1 and you'll be able to continuously share your ideas with us. What's more? As one of Montreal's fastest-growing startups, GoMaterials is revolutionizing the procurement process in the landscape construction industry! Our B2B marketplace optimizes how landscape contractors source plant and hardscape materials and has allowed us to be named one of Canada's most innovative companies in 2018 by Innovations of the World ( Over the last 3 years, we have helped landscapers save time, money, and stress and plant over 1 million plants and trees. Description: Location: Montreal West  Data analysis roadmap Automate processes via Power BI and programming  For a large international listed company, you will work as a Senior Data Analysis Advisor for internal audit in a growing environment that participates in the development of its employees. Profile: Bilingual candidate, 5 to 10 years of experience in internal audit and / or business intelligence, holder of a bachelor's degree in computer science , in business administration, management, accounting or related field, advanced knowledge of Excel and data analysis and visualization tools (e.g. Power BI), strong sense of initiative, 'agility and adaptability, team spirit and strong interpersonal skills, the ability to influence others and gain their support. The CPA, CIA, CISA or CFE designation is an asset.

Lieu : Montréal Ouest  Mise en place d’une approche moderne de l’audit interne Automatiser les processus via Power BI et programmation  Pour une grande entreprise internationale cotée en bourse, vous travaillerez comme étant analyste de donnée en audit interne dans un environnement en croissance qui participe au développement de ses employés.  Au sein de ce poste, vous devrez élaborer, améliorer et mettre en œuvre les solutions et les résultats en matière d'analyse des données. Vous devrez être capable contribuer de manière experte aux missions d'audit et de conseil en proposant et en exécutant des scripts d'analyse de données conçues pour accroître la qualité et l'efficacité des audits, conformément aux dernières normes du secteur et à l'évolution des pratiques. Par la suite, vous devrez élaborer des rapports de visualisation des données tel que Power BI pour présenter les informations de manière crédible et convaincante.  Vous devrez ainsi analyser et interpréter les résultats des scripts d'analyse des données ; examiner les résultats avec les responsables des unités auditées et formuler des recommandations. Enfin, vous aiderez à améliorer la gestion des risques et des opportunités. L’environnement est propice pour l’avancement professionnel.  Profil : Candidat bilingue, 2 à 5 ans d'expérience dans l'audit interne et/ou l'intelligence économique, titulaire d'un baccalauréat en informatique, en administration des affaires, en gestion, en comptabilité ou dans un domaine connexe, connaissance avancée d'Excel et des outils d'analyse et de visualisation des données (par exemple, Power BI), curieux méticuleux, organisé et motivé, ayant l'esprit d'équipe et de solides compétences relationnelles. Le titre CPA, CIA, CISA ou CFE est un atout.

Job Description  The Risk Analyst will assist in the implementation and maintenance of the Operational Risk Management framework, which also includes oversight and challenge of the management of Information Security, Cybersecurity and Technology risks across LBCFG. The incumbent will consult with management on the efficiency and effectiveness of controls to identify gaps and recommend enhancements to reduce LBCFG's risk exposure to an acceptable level within its risk appetite. He/she is also required to keep up-to-date with current legislation, policies, programs, procedures and market trends and advise management on risk related concerns    ºMaintain the Operational Risk Management (including IT Risk) framework, including the Risk universe and Key Risk Indicators ºAssist in the development, update and maintenance of the Process Risk & Control Assessments (PRCAs) and related activities ºProvide Risk Advisory services ºReview the design and operating effectiveness of Information Security, Cybersecurity and Technology controls; and provide recommendations on how to efficiently minimize identified risk exposures ºOversee Information Security, Cybersecurity and Technology risk management activities across LBCFG ºFacilitate or execute risk assessments for significant initiatives and vendors, and high-risk information assets and systems ºProduce input and analytics for centralized risk reporting and management decision making - on a regular/ad-hoc basis.    ºUniversity degree in an appropriate field or College diploma (DEC) in computer science ºUp to 8 years of experience in Information Security, Cybersecurity, Technology and Digital Risk Management ºCertificate in information security or IT risk management (CISSP, CISA, CISM, CRISC, ISO27001 and/or other), an asset ºIn-depth knowledge of IT risk and IT security management concepts, practices and methods ºStrong analytical skills, including risk analysis, data analysis, and comparative analysis ºPractical knowledge of key concepts: probability, impact, inherent risk, security control, residual risk, compensating control ºAbility to work in ambiguity, must be flexible to deal with changes in a fast paced and new environment, working closely with peers where subject matter expertise is required ºPractices and methods: NIST 800-53, OSFI, ISO27001 ºExcellent communication skills (oral and written) including presentation skills and demonstrated ability to present at all organizational levels ºResults oriented with the ability to work independently and as part of a team, managing multiple priorities within tight deadlines  Additional Information  Founded in 1846, Laurentian Bank Financial Group is a diversified financial services provider whose mission is to help its customers improve their financial health. The Laurentian Bank of Canada and its entities are collectively referred to as Laurentian Bank Financial Group (the "Group" or the "Bank").  With more than 3,200 employees guided by the values of proximity, simplicity and honesty, the Group provides a broad range of advice-based solutions and services to its personal, business and institutional customers.  With pan-Canadian activities and a presence in the U.S., the Group is an important player in numerous market segments.  The role is to fill under Laurentian Bank a subsidiary of the Laurentian Bank Financial Group.

Post: Senior Business Analyst - Digital Systems Integration
Location: St John’s, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada
Description: Requisition ID: 32668  Job Category: Engineering  With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining, energy, and infrastructure sectors, we understand that challenges are changing rapidly in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff with experience in over 150 countries to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve.  With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining, energy, and infrastructure sectors, we understand that challenges are changing rapidly in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff with experience in over 150 countries to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve.  Digital has become a fundamental part of our clients’ strategies, driving more efficiencies and effectiveness to their way of working and operating. As a result, clients have embarked on the journey of implementing digital and automation technologies, such as Industrial Internet of Things platforms, Cloud and Edge Devices, Advanced Analytics, Digital Assets / Twins, Wearables, 3D Environments, Augmented / Virtual Reality and among others.  The challenge that many of our clients face is to get started in the execution of this journey - how to make it practical and relevant for their operations without sacrificing safety, how to prove the value of the technologies, how to identify the right technologies, how to select the right suppliers and how to ensure that each party deliver accordingly. Often, these projects are executed on isolation without adequate visibility to continuously quantify the benefits or to identify improvement opportunities. Multiple technologies are been implemented without a good plan and integrated architecture in mind, diminishing the return of value that clients are getting from their investment.    The successful candidate will need to have an entrepreneurial technical soul with demonstrated experience participating on vision and strategy development for the application of digital technologies in operating sites (either plants, mines, ports, rail, etc.).  The Business Analyst / Digital Systems Integration Consultant role requires someone who can consolidate complex expectations and requirements from various stakeholders into a common set of documents to support the project. The Digital transformation journey touches many areas. We are looking for candidates with experience and expertise on Production Management, Operations Management, Energy Management, Asset Management, Logistics and Supply Chain Management. Description: Description  Position at Zynga  Zynga is a leading developer of the world’s most popular social games that are played by millions of people around the world each day. To-date, more than 1 billion people have played our games across Web and mobile, including Words With Friends, FarmVille, Zynga Poker, Merge Dragons, Empires & Puzzles, Hit it Rich! Slots and CSR.  Zynga’s data science and analytics team uses our unique and expansive data to model and predict user behavior, making our games more personalized and more fun to play! We strive for a better understanding of our players which translates into challenges and features that delight them and increased social engagement within our games.  Here’s where you would come in: identify and formalize problems to understand user behavior. Create systems and analyses to derive insights that change the studio’s world view. Be innovative, be creative, use every bit of that key commodity – data. Millions of people play Zynga games every day, so our data is tremendously rich and we have a lot of it!  We will rely on you to communicate your findings to your peers – both technical and non-technical. Your solutions to difficult problems will need to be demonstrably impactful, visual and maintainable. You will work with our game teams to put your models into production. You will collaborate with Product Managers, Game Designers, and Engineers to deliver business impact, changing current practices in line with new findings and insights.       Zynga is an equal opportunity employer. We are proud of our diverse community; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other class or characteristic protected by applicable law. We encourage candidates, players, employees, and partners from all backgrounds. Join us!  Zynga will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.

Post: Advanced Business Analyst, EAX Analytics (12-month term)
Description: At EA, we have a clear vision for the future of gaming – connecting a billion people around the world to play. If you are passionate about analytics and want to be a part of the industry transformation through the EA player network, come join us to represent the voice of players via data-driven insights.  We are looking for an Advanced Business Analyst to join the Studios Data and Insights team to work on player network projects. You will have access to data across the entire EA ecosystem to create insights and narratives to help our partners make decisions to transform our platform and improve our player communities. You will be based at Vancouver, building relationships with Product Development, Design, Live Service, Commerce, Product Marketing, Finance and Ops teams.  The candidate will also collaborate with their peers across the Studios Data and Insights organization from North America and Europe. The ideal candidate is an independent analyst who can extract data, cleanse, analyze, iterate, enrich, model, document and present their findings.
Industry: Computer GamesInformation Technology and ServicesComputer Software

Description: About The Company  Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. At EA, we exist to inspire the world to play. You might recognize some of the games in our portfolio, like The Sims™, Madden NFL, EA SPORTS™ FIFA, Battlefield™, Dragon Age™, Apex Legends™, Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order™ and Plants vs. Zombies™.    Come join EA’s People Analytics organization, where we lead EA’s talent strategy. We help EA’s leaders informed decisions on how to attract, retain and optimize EA’s workforce. You will be a part of EA’s dynamic HR team where analytics is an important contributor to transforming the HR team.    You understand people and the HR team, and enjoy using data and analytics to bring order to ambiguous problems, driving towards business goals. From building data visualization to help our Studios Leadership understand their talent trends, to helping model out the actions that EA has to take to meet our strategic talent aspirations, you will be the Engine supplying the analytical power to help EA win in the talent marketplace.
Industry: Computer GamesInformation Technology and ServicesComputer Software

Description: Advanced Analyst  The EA Marketing Analytics team is looking for an analytics professional to take on the role of Advanced Analyst at our Vancouver studio. At EA, an Advanced Analyst is a Manager-level team contributor, and we are looking for someone who can take our analytics to a new level by digging into diverse data sets relating to our marketing campaigns, applying leading edge data analytics techniques, conducting experiments, extracting insights, creating evocative data visualizations and communicating recommendations to our marketing partners in ways that create clarity and influence the business.    In addition to an ability to build statistical models that turn numbers into knowledge, we are looking for strategic business acumen and the ability to build relationships across a global network of technical, marketing, and communications teams. You need to be able to use data to become a trusted advisor to our marketing partners, allowing us to reach new heights in our player acquisition, engagement, and monetization programs. If you can combine this with a pioneering spirit, commitment to team success, and a passion for the video game industry, this might be the right job for you.
Industry: Computer GamesInformation Technology and ServicesComputer Software

Description: Location: Siem Reap, Cambodia  Duration: Minimum 3 months, maximum 12 months commitment  Cost: $490 for 3 months  Fee Includes: all food, accommodation, pre-departure + in-country support, orientation and all project related activities  Does not Include: flights, airport pickup, travel insurance, personal spending, visas and vaccinations  This opportunity is designed to give you the contacts and experience to help further your career. You are not replacing any member of staff, but helping alongside them, whilst learning new skills.  : Project is on-going, you are able to join at any time, subject to availability    Cambodia has had a challenging and dark history, and continues to be one of the poorest countries in the world. Long-term development remains an ongoing problem, with serious skill shortages affecting over two million people, who live on less than $2 per day. Our aim is to match the appropriately skilled volunteer with the right local Cambodian project. By doing we can make a more sustainable longer-term impact.  You will be working with a small, independent, multi-award winning, travel agency, based in Siem Reap - home to the incredible Angkor Wat temples. We want to take our agency to the next level, and in order to do that, we need a Business Analyst with expertise to implement Salesforce as part of our business process, to help make the organisation more financially sustainable.  Joining us as a Business Analyst, with knowledge of Salesforce, you will help us implement this CRM into our business process. By doing this we aim to be more financially sustainable, and ultimately share a successful project, underpinned by robust infrastructure, with the local Khmer team when they take over in two years.  We need you to help purchase and implement the software, define the process workflow with the help of the Social Media Manager, set up the reporting framework and draft a procedures manual for ongoing use. You will work directly with the Director and Founder, whilst also supporting the handover to local staff. Being able to manage the project end-to-end is key, as you will be the only team member with this skillset. Therefore, being independent, flexible and adaptable to working in a different culture is key.  The working environment is really unique - our office is a converted house, with a nice garden. The team is a mixed group of local Cambodians and Westerners, which creates a great energy and relaxed working style.  Whilst working with us you will have your own desk with access to a project computer or laptop, good WiFi, the use of a bicycle to get around and flexibility in terms of your working hours. We enjoy team events and excursions and encourage everyone to get involved.  all information above is subject to change. Please check the most up to date information on the Global Nomadic website when applying.
Industry: Marketing and AdvertisingNonprofit Organization ManagementHospital & Health Care

Description: Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.      Reporting into the Manager of WAM Business Technology, as Business Analyst you will research and analyze improvement opportunities, conduct workflow analysis, prepare requirements / refine stories and facilitate implementation of technology solutions. You will collaborate with and represent the sales stakeholders for requirements refinement, light system administration, enhancements, project work and ongoing change management. This unique yet critical business role will appeal to those of you with a real passion for tinkering and enhancing sales tools’ solutions. By contributing to standard methodologies and technological improvements this role will help drive business strategy and create process efficiencies across the organization.                     Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of March 31, 2020, we had $1.2 trillion (US$0.8 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $30.4 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.  Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention and advancement and we administer all of our practices and programs based on qualification and performance and without discrimination on any protected ground. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. The Finance Processes and Modernization team is responsible for transforming, digitizing and evolving finance to create process efficiencies and higher value impact with our franchise. It also involves developing and maintaining high-quality, well-controlled Finance and Treasury processes and its related governance requirements across all of businesses globally. This organization is a key contributor to driving and executing on our overall Finance Transformation. In partnership with Group Functions Technology and Global Data team, the Finance Processes and Modernization team is accountable for implementing the continued transformation and automation of our Treasury processes using new tools ensuring efficient and controlled processing of client and vendor payments. Key responsibilities of the area are: data governance/quality/maintenance/integrity, ongoing operational support (including monitoring, setup, and end user support), application development, supporting global financial process change initiatives and leading change throughout the business units, implementing changes and upgrades to the ERP, data marts structures and all other supported tools, and maintaining a controlled, reliable, accessible and stable financial reporting environment.  The incumbent will be part of Treasury Processes team working on projects involving new or existing applications and processes. Their primary responsibility is to ensure system solutions and related processes support overall company objectives and ensure the integrity and quality of financial data. Description: ANALYSTE DE DONNÉES TECHNOLOGIES DE L’INFORMATION TEMPS COMPLET – PERMANENT – 35 H  Notre Contrat  Relevant de la directrice, Technologies de l’information, le titulaire de ce poste est responsable de la conformité des données statistiques soumises par l’Organisme. Il est chargé d’évaluer l’exactitude et l’intégrité des données reçues et émises. Par l’analyse de l’ensemble des données, il est responsable de les traduire en informations et statistiques opérationnelles afin de générer des rapports et des tableaux de bord selon le public cible. Il s’assure du suivi des indicateurs d’affaires et conseille les clients internes dans l’utilisation et l’interprétation des données.  Il joue un rôle-conseil de première ligne auprès d'intervenants internes dans des dossiers ou des projets reliés à son domaine d'expertise. Il appuie également l’équipe des analystes d’affaires et la direction TI lors de l’analyse des besoins d’affaires des services et des processus opérationnels en collaboration avec les experts métiers de l’organisation. Il collabore à la mise à jour des exigences, des spécifications et des processus, et recommande des solutions innovantes.     Faites-nous parvenir votre curriculum vitæ. L’utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n’a aucune intention discriminatoire.  Nous vous remercions de l’intérêt que vous témoignez pour ce poste, cependant nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes dont la candidature aura été retenue.

Description De L'entreprise  ES-TU FORGÉ POUR KENNY U-PULL?  Kenny U-pull est une division de la Compagnie Américaine Fer et Métaux inc. qui est reconnue comme un chef de file mondial dans l’industrie du recyclage des métaux. Chez Kenny U-Pull, nous réutilisons des véhicules et leurs pièces en leur donnant une deuxième vie. Nous opérons selon des normes strictes afin de maintenir un milieu de travail productif et organisé. Prépare-toi à une immersion dans le monde automobile. En te joignant, à l’équipe du Centre d’appels, tu deviens l’allié de nos clients en leur fournisant le meilleur service. Faire partie de Kenny u-pull est faire partie d’une équipe qui est une entreprise de premier plan en Amérique du Nord dans l’industrie du libre-service automobile. C’est simple: nous le faisons bien. Nous visons l’excellence.    En tant qu'analyste de données, vous contribuez au développement et à l'utilisation d'outils et de méthodes pour collecter, compiler, modéliser et superviser la qualité des données transactionnelles. Vous ferez partie d'une équipe dont le mandat est de développer des connaissances en intelligence d'affaires pour soutenir la prise de décision et aider les décideurs à comprendre la situation dans son ensemble. Votre rôle consiste à analyser et à diagnostiquer les problèmes liés aux données, à fournir des avis conformément aux données et informations existantes, et à élaborer des recommandations et des plans de mise en œuvre.  Principales responsabilités

One of our government clients is looking for a Salesforce Business Analyst Length: Contract term is 13 months + with a possibility of extension  Location: Toronto, ON  Role: This role will be supporting the current business anlayst team with multiple projects that are already underway on a project involving the Salesforce platform. Resource will assist with gathering business requirements, presenting business solutions, training, and other duties. They will work closely with public health nurses and contract tracers.  Responsibilities: -Lead and conduct business analysis at varying levels of detail with relevant stakeholders (e.g. public health units, Public Health Ontario, the ministry), appropriate to the project and phases of project, aligning with Ontario Government Unified Project Management Methodology, Enterprise Architecture and Gating Process, and Agile Systems/ Ontario Government Standard Systems Development Methodologies -Provide a comprehensive range of I&IT business analysis lead services for diverse business and technology needs, including development and maintenance of business relationships and providing ongoing I&IT advice for improvements to/options for business development -Prepare and advise on business analysis policies, processes, best practices and standards to promote a comprehensive and consistent business analysis practice within the organization -Conduct ongoing business analysis activities and analysis within all phases of the project life cycle, including initial technical requirements, detailed plan of business analysis activity, business modeling, analysis of business transformation, new business development and acquired solutions, continual refinement of business requirements and identification of significant changes in requirement documentation, and maintenance of approved business requirement -Analyse defects and work with relevant parties in resolving of these defects -Support any data migration and related activities as needed from legacy system to new provincial system -Apply re-engineering concepts to promote business improvements through alternative, cost effective service delivery approaches -Provide impact analysis and requirement/specification creation for supported initiatives due to Case and Contact Management solution and alignment with the provincial Digital Health Immunization Repository -Lead subject matter experts and stakeholder working groups, conduct business analysis to assess client's current business problems, defects, improvements and minor enhancements -Document the business requirements in such a way that technology solutions can be determined -Liaise with the development and Quality Assurance teams, inclusive of third party vendor and ministry teams -Present complex information equally well to technical and non-technical audience and act as a knowledgeable liaison between technical teams and business stakeholders during the implementation phase -Promote the appropriate application of I&IT to business problems, and undertake comprehensive business needs assessments and analysis of complex business requirements for IT business solutions -Develop and maintain business processes and user documentation for the Case and Contact Management solution, including support for infectious disease public health activities, infectious disease case, contact, and outbreak investigation and management, immunization administration, and vaccine distribution and delivery (inventory) -Develop training materials / support the development of training materials as well as deliver / support the delivery of training relevant to the areas of accountability of the CCM solution assigned to the Business Analyst -Prepare and respond to queries from executives relevant to the assigned areas of accountability of the provincial solution    Must Haves: * Please see below matrix for full evaluation criteria -10+ years of strong business analyst skills and producing quality work -Very strong written and verbal communication skills - experience writing strategy documents and presenting to executive level users -Prior experience within Digital IT public health sector preferred -Prior experience working with the Salesforce platform -Experience working in the Agile framework -Ability to analyze data and make recommendations - knowledgeable of work flows and following data models -Involved with various large scale implementation projects  Experience and Skill Set Requirements IT Knowledge and Experience       Business Analysis Skills     Public Sector Experience

Description: Company Description  ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR AIM GLOBAL?  Become a part of AIM Global’s history.  We have continued to prosper for the last eight decades through our employees’ strength and our clients’ trust, thus establishing our international presence and diversifying our expertise. Take your place at AIM Global, an integrated chain comprised of five divisions who work in collaboration to revalorize resources such as metals, construction waste, end-of-life vehicles and urban areas. We invest in our installations and employees to ensure a better future for all.  It’s simple; we do it right. We aim for excellence.    As a data analyst, you help develop and use tools and methods to collect, compile, model and oversee the quality of transactional data. You will be part of a team whose mandate is to develop business intelligence knowledge to support decision-making and help decisionmakers understand the big picture. Your role covers analyzing and helping diagnose issues related to the data, providing opinions in accordance with the existing data and information, and developing recommendations and implementation plans. Also, As Data Governance Specialist will play a key role is supporting AIM operations by monitoring and analyzing master data, key data, and master relationship data within the organization

Description: Êtes-vous ressourceur? Veolia aide ses clients à améliorer leur rendement énergétique, à mieux gérer leur édifices, leur eaux, leur eaux usées et à transformer leur déchets en ressources. Nous le faisons en trouvant des solutions sécuritaires, rentables et innovantes que nous apportons à nos multiples clients (entreprises, garages, hôpitaux, municipalités, etc). Ces derniers font de nous LA référence mondiale en environnement.  Veolia assurera pendant 34 ans la gestion des énergies, du cycle de vie des actifs, ainsi que l’entretien du nouveau Centre Hospitalier de l’Université de Montréal (CHUM).    Pour participer pleinement à l'économie circulaire canadienne, nous pouvons compter sur plus de 1500 employés comme vous.   Sous l’autorité de la Responsable Fiabilité et Opérations des Systèmes de Transport Automatisés, l’Analyste BI - Fiabilité et opérations des systèmes automatisés est la personne qui aura comme principale tâche d’analyser les données quant au bon fonctionnement, l’optimisation et le suivi des performances des différents équipements et systèmes de transport automatisés (STA) du nouveau CHUM. Parmi ces systèmes de transports automatisés, vous trouverez entre autres les véhicules automatisés de transport (VAG), les systèmes de transport pneumatiques (STP) ainsi que les systèmes de transports verticaux (ascenseurs, monte-charges et escaliers mobiles). L’analyste observe, analyse et détecte les tendances dans le but de développer des outils, méthodes et moyens pour améliorer la productivité, l'efficacité, la surveillance et la fiabilité de fonctionnement des différents systèmes de transport automatisés, tout en diminuant le nombre de défaillances des équipements et les coûts d’entretien.       Poste temporaire d'un an à temps plein dont l’horaire de travail est de jour, sur semaine. Le titulaire de ce poste devra cependant faire preuve de disponibilité en période de grande production et devra être apte à travailler sous pression, occasionnellement.   Les candidat(e)s intéressé(e)s à postuler sur ce poste doivent faire parvenir leur CV via l'adresse suivante: https://veolia.taleo.net/careersection/extexp/jobdetail.ftl?job=120271&lang=fr_FR#, sur Jobillico ou au ca.emploi@veolia.com.  L'utilisation du masculin dans le présent document a pour seul but d'alléger le texte.

The SQA is accountable for the planning, collection, and reporting of accurate and timely data.

Description: Address  100 King Street West  Job Family Group  Finance & Accounting Consolidates, analyzes, and reports on the financial performance of the business / group to support the month-, quarter-, and year-end closing process, including financial reporting and financial governance. Supports an efficient and effective accounting function that uses common information sources and practices, reduces ongoing costs, and increases service level performance.      At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.  As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. Company Name: Export Development Canada | Exportation et développement Canada - EDC
Description: EDC is Canada’s export credit agency, offering information, knowledge and innovative commercial solutions to help Canadian exporters and investors expand their international business. We take on risk so Canadian businesses can take on the world.  When you join our team, you’ll be helping Canadian companies bring their vision, passion and innovation to the global marketplace. Your knowledge and expertise will support more than 13,000 Canadian companies and their customers in as many as 200 markets worldwide. You’ll work shoulder-to-shoulder with the best and brightest in an inclusive, collaborative environment that fosters professional development and success. And you’ll know that you’re making a difference every day—for companies, for Canada and for the people you work with.  Year after year, EDC has been recognized as a Top 100 and Top Family-Friendly Employer.    In the Risk Quantification group, the Risk Data and Analytics team is responsible for building and maintaining an information infrastructure of data representing the full portfolio of EDC’s transactions across all business lines. It consolidates, certifies, and publishes the exposure data for use as the official corporate source.  The Risk Data Analyst or Associate in Risk Data and Analytics requires experience in the domains of finance, risk exposure, and transactional data. Additionally, the Risk Data Analyst or Associate requires experience in business information systems and the information requirements of clients and co-stakeholders of exposure data. This role also contributes to the business certification of exposure data, exposure data monitoring and reporting, and sourcing data from the Corporate Data Warehouse, Data Marts, and systems of record.

Company Name: Export Development Canada | Exportation et développement Canada - EDC
Post: Analyste (Associé-e) des données sur les risques
Description: Organisme de crédit à l’exportation du Canada, EDC offre de l’information, des connaissances et des solutions commerciales novatrices pour aider les exportateurs et les investisseurs canadiens à réussir sur les marchés mondiaux. Nous assumons les risques; nos clients, eux, partent à la conquête du monde.  En vous joignant à notre équipe, vous aiderez des entreprises canadiennes à étendre leur vision, leur passion et leur sens de l’innovation au marché mondial. Vos connaissances et votre expertise serviront à plus de 13 000 entreprises canadiennes et à leurs clients sur plus de 200 marchés partout dans le monde. Vous travaillerez aux côtés de la crème de la crème, dans un environnement inclusif et collaboratif propice au perfectionnement professionnel et à la réussite. Chaque jour, vous aurez le sentiment d’avoir accompli quelque chose d’utile pour ces entreprises, le Canada et vos collègues.  Année après année, EDC s’est classée au rang des 100 meilleurs employeurs, et parmi les entreprises canadiennes favorisant le plus la famille.    Au sein du Groupe de la quantification des risques, l’Équipe de gouvernance des données de risques et analytique est chargée de créer et de maintenir une infrastructure d’information des données représentant l’ensemble du portefeuille des transactions d’EDC pour tous les secteurs d’activité. Elle regroupe, certifie et publie les données d’exposition pour utilisation en tant que source officielle de la Société.  L’analyste ou l’associé des données sur les risques, Gouvernance des données de risques et analytique, possède de l’expérience des domaines des finances, de l’exposition au risque et des données transactionnelles. De plus, le titulaire possède de l’expérience des systèmes d’information d’affaires et des exigences en matière d’information des clients et des co-parties prenantes des données d’exposition. Ce rôle contribue également à la certification d’affaires des données d’exposition, à la surveillance sur les données d’exposition et à l’établissement de rapports sur ceux-ci, et à l’obtention de données de l’entrepôt de données d’entreprise, des dépôts de données et des systèmes d’enregistrement.

The position sits at the intersection of the Product, and Engineering. You will help with asking the right questions and answering them rigorously. You'll work closely with Product Managers to understand their goals and proactively inform their direction with data and provide guidance to the engineers and prototyping various solutions.  Relevant advertising industry experience is useful, but ultimately less so than your demonstrated abilities and attitude. Post: Statistical Data Analyst – The First Nations Information Governance Centre - Ottawa
Description: The First Nations Information Governance Centre (FNIGC) is a non-profit organization that envisions every First Nation achieving data sovereignty in alignment with its distinct world view.  FNIGC supports the development of information governance at the First Nations community level through regional and national partnerships. In addition to serving the information, research, training, and capacity development needs of First Nations people and communities, FNIGC is home to the First Nations Regional Health Survey (FNRHS), the First Nations Regional Early Childhood, Education, and Employment Survey (FNREEES), and the First Nations Labour and Employment Development (FNLED) survey.  FNIGC believes that quality information collected has the power to change lives, by influencing knowledge-based decision-making and inspiring effective policy and programs for all First Nations communities.    The Statistical Data Analyst is a highly skilled professional that is part of a dynamic team that will provide statistical support to FNIGC’s survey processes. The Statistical Data Analyst reports to the Research & Information Management Team and will work in collaboration with the other teams of FNIGC in the preparation of various reports and publications.      The Statistical Data Analyst should have a Master’s degree in a discipline using quantitative analytical approaches preferably in social sciences, humanities, epidemiology, public health or statistics.  A minimum of three years working experience in quantitative analysis to support policy development and/or research is required. Other combinations of education and experience may be considered.  Experience conducting research and data analysis in relation to First Nations issues as well as experience working with First Nations is a definite asset.    The successful candidate will be eligible for a competitive salary, a benefits package, and a pension plan.  This position is normally located in Ottawa, but due to the pandemic, the work can be done remotely from anywhere in Canada (with reliable internet).  Please send your résumé and cover letter telling us why you think you’d be a great addition the FNIGC team to recruitment@fnigc.ca by November 27, 2020.  As preference in hiring will be given to First Nations candidates, applicants are encouraged to self-identify. FNIGC is committed to accommodating people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Company Name: Export Development Canada | Exportation et développement Canada - EDC
Post: Risk Analyst/Senior Risk Analyst, Risk Assessment & Portfolio Management (Level 2 to Level 4)
Description: EDC is Canada’s export credit agency, offering information, knowledge and innovative commercial solutions to help Canadian exporters and investors expand their international business. We take on risk so Canadian businesses can take on the world.  When you join our team, you’ll be helping Canadian companies bring their vision, passion and innovation to the global marketplace. Your knowledge and expertise will support more than 13,000 Canadian companies and their customers in as many as 200 markets worldwide. You’ll work shoulder-to-shoulder with the best and brightest in an inclusive, collaborative environment that fosters professional development and success. And you’ll know that you’re making a difference every day—for companies, for Canada and for the people you work with. Year after year, EDC has been recognized as a Top 100 and Top Family-Friendly Employer.    The Risk Assessment & Portfolio Management (RAPM) team monitors the Insurance portfolio, performing independent credit risk assessment and portfolio management and ensuring that appropriate action is taken when the credit risk of a company is no longer considered acceptable. RAPM participates in the ongoing review of the Insurance group's credit granting and credit surveillance standards and its policies and procedures for risk acceptance.  We are looking for dynamic and motivated credit professionals to manage a portfolio of buyers, performing independent credit and financial risk assessment to assess the commercial risk acceptance and repayment capabilities of these companies, in support of our Insurance program.

Post: Data Analyst Intern, Global Investments IT (4-month Term Winter 2021)
Description: Why join us? Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor? If so, we would love to tell you our story.At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.  As a key member of the Global Investments IT team, the role of Data Analyst is instrumental in enhancing data & analytics capabilities by championing industry best practices and delivering high quality datasets, reports, and training to enhance business decision making. The candidate will develop Power BI datasets and reports to support OMERS investment entities, deliver training workshops to promote data culture, and maintain a healthy business relationship to assist in meeting business demands. The individual must also support and collaborate with data engineers, data scientists and investment professionals and engage in technical support, research and knowledge sharing through the implementation lifecycle of projects and solutions.  This role is accountable for ensuring that all projects, solutions and platforms align with and support overall enterprise Data & Technology strategy & goals, and adhere to company policies, industry standards and best practices.        Technical experience   Education    Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $109 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2019. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Job Description  Numerator is looking for a talented and passionate Business Intelligence Developer to join our team in either our Chicago or Ottawa office. As part of our BI team, you will be responsible for helping to develop visualizations for datasets that are used by fortune 500 brands and retailers. Day-to-day, you’ll come up with creative solutions to complex problems, and learn new skills to complement your existing abilities.  This is a great role for those who are looking for hands-on experience with high visibility and impact. We welcome fresh ideas and approaches as we constantly aim to improve our development processes. Our team has experience using a wide range of technologies and years of cloud and big data experience. We are always learning and growing, so we can guarantee that you won’t be bored with us! If you are seeking an environment where you get to do meaningful work with other great engineers, then we want to hear from you!       3+ years of experience in business intelligence  Advanced development capabilities with BI tools such as Spotfire; ability to drill-down or drill-through to other supporting reports.  Experience with setting up extract refreshes and data connections on Spotfire server and troubleshooting  Proficiency with SQL writing and debugging skills in its variation among databases (Snowflake, PostgreSQL and Redshift).  Experience developing and implementing enterprise-scale reports and dashboards.  Knowledge in an Agile software development environment  Experience with version control systems (Git, Subversion, etc.).  Ability to plan resource requirements from high level specifications, Data Analysis, including data collection.  Eager to expand your knowledge and abilities in data visualization tools and technologies.  You look ahead to identify opportunities and foster a culture of innovation.    Experience in a language for statistical computing (Python/pandas).  Experience working with different datasets, industries and stakeholders (internals & externals).  Strong Business acumen. MBA or experience as a business analyst is a strong asset.  Passionate about data visualization and its ability to tell a story.  Familiarity with JSON and similar data formats.  Expertise with big data, analytics, machine learning, and personalization.  Ability to present, demonstrate and communicate effectively.    We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Industry: Information Technology and ServicesMarket ResearchInformation Services

Post: Senior Analyst, Loyalty Marketing - Canadian Tire Corporation
Description: Help us boldly shape retail in Canada  Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.  It’s an exciting time to be in Loyalty here at Canadian Tire Corporation!. Join our team and you will be a part of Canada’s oldest loyalty rewards program that is striving to be the most innovative as well. Triangle Rewards members collect electronic Canadian Tire ‘Money’ and get access to exclusive benefits such as personalized offers, weekly flyer bonuses and events. The Triangle Rewards program is leveraging technology to better understand customers and build relationships by offering a more personalized experience. Join us and help lead the transformation of Canada’s most iconic loyalty program!  The role of Senior Analyst, Loyalty is responsible for all areas of measurement for the Triangle Rewards loyalty program. Specifically, the responsibilities of the role include tracking key program health metrics (issuance, active customers, etc.), conducting post campaign analysis, and monitoring loyalty channel performance. In addition, the Senior Analyst, Loyalty will be tasked with operationalizing and automating key loyalty data to allow for real time reporting (Ex: Dashboard creation). In addition to leading the day to day management of loyalty data, the role requires a keen eye for opportunity identification and the ability to translate insights into future program strategies. In the role, the Senior Analyst, Loyalty will work closely with the Loyalty Manager and Senior Loyalty Consultant to develop future program strategies that result in increased customer engagement and overall program growth.             Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Top Employers .  To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn .  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.  Ontario-Toronto  Permanent  Full-time    Nov 20, 2020, 4:21:43 PM

Post: Senior Analyst, Credit Risk Analytics - New Grad (2020 start)
Description: Address  100 King Street West  Job Family Group  Data Analytics & Reporting Mandate / Marketability The Senior Analyst, Credit Risk Analytics is accountable for executing improvement initiatives across BMO’s enterprise risk capital and stress testing area, specifically the SAS platform. This includes enhancements to help SAS operate more efficiently and effectively, translating business needs into business and data requirements and SAS capabilities. This role delivers high business impact given it is accountable for supporting required improvements/capabilities for the total bank credit portfolio at the enterprise level. This role also coordinates activies across a multitude of stakeholders, within and across Operating Groups, Risk, Finance, Economics, T&O, vendors, etc.  Key Accountabilities  Establish and formulate business requirements and capabilities necessary to support credit risk analytics across the Operating Groups, Material Risk Groups, and RCMD (45%) ▪ Gather and document credit risk analytics infrastructure requirments and the deliverables. ▪ Identify opportunities to improve credit risk analytics infrastructure in a more efficient and effective manner across the enterprise. Provide timely, insightful, forward-looking, and actionable recommendations to enhance the credit risk analytics infrastructure solution. ▪ Develop and recommend alternatives/enhancements for the credit risk analytics infrastructure projects, that improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the SAS tools. ▪ Support an improvement agenda for continuous improvement of business processes and procedures within the scope of the team’s responsibilites. Support continuous improvement of the broader RCMD organization and risk analytics processes. ▪ Increase the effectiveness and efficiency of existing operational methods and workflows by identifying and implementing process improvements. ▪ Expand the knowedge set by understanding a range of practices regarding credit risk management, coverage, and usage among peers in the financial services industry. ▪ Identify implementation approaches, tools, and processes for the credit risk analytics projects. ▪ Support the development of prototypes or ad-hoc reports using the SAS platform based on emerging business needs or risk analytic needs using new and efficient approaches.  Support the Credit Risk Analytics Requirements and Capabilities (45%) ▪ Act as business advisor to technology team for implementation of wholesale and retail credit risk management models and processes. ▪ Support strategic and operational guidance to group’s within and outside of Corporate Risk Management on matters related to credit risk analytics, economic capital, regulatory capital, and capital demand processes. ▪ Provide support in responding to Internal/External Auditors and Regulators on matters involving the credit risk analytics infrastructure on current and future deliverables.  Training / Business User Support / Knowledge Transfer (10%) ▪ Provide business user support including responses to inquiries, information, and training support; proactively manage the communications and business support process. ▪ Develop and provide training materials and knowledge transfer to the SAS platform business users. Sophos evolves to meet every new challenge, protecting more than 400,000 organizations of all sizes in more than 150 countries from today’s most advanced cyberthreats.  Powered by SophosLabs, our cloud-native and AI-enhanced solutions are able to adapt and evolve to secure endpoints and networks against never-before-seen cybercriminal tactics and techniques. Managed through our award-winning, cloud-based platform, Sophos Central, our best-of-breed products work together through our unique Synchronized Security system to share threat intelligence and respond to evolving threats. The Sophos suite of products secures networks and endpoints against automated and active-adversary breaches, ransomware, malware, exploits, data exfiltration, phishing, and more. Job Purpose Sophos Managed Threat Response (MTR) is an elite team of threat hunters and incident response experts who work on behalf of our customers to investigate and neutralize the most sophisticated of threats. As an Incident Response Analyst, you will work with customers who are experiencing an active cyber incident, to quickly investigate, contain and assist with their recovery. You will work with both large and small organizations across multiple countries and levels of technical maturity. IDS, IPS, EDR, Malware defenses and monitoring experienceThreat hunting experience preferredExperience administering and supporting Windows and one of the following: Apple or Linux based operating systems, both workstations and server (e.g. XP, Windows 7, 2003, 2008, OS X)Understanding of Windows event log analysisAdvanced Information Security certifications preferred but not required (Job Code 4020)

About Hopper  At Hopper, we’re on a mission to make booking travel faster, easier, and more transparent. We are leveraging the power that comes from combining massive amounts of data and machine learning to build the world’s fastest-growing travel app -- one that enables our customers to save money and travel more. With over $235M CAD in funding from leading investors in both Canada and the US, Hopper is primed to continue its path toward becoming the go-to way to book travel as the world continues its shift to mobile.  Recognized as the fastest-growing travel app by Forbes and one of the world’s most innovative companies by Fast Company two years in a row, Hopper has been downloaded over 40 million times and has helped travelers plan over 100 million trips and counting. The app has received high praise in the form of mobile accolades such as the Webby Award for Best Travel App of 2019, the Google Play Award for Standout Startup of 2016 and Apple’s App Store Best of 2015.  Take off with us!    We’re looking for our future finance leaders; a great analytical mind with impeccable business judgment, who is really interested in understanding Hopper’s revenue streams deeply and helping us craft our long term financial and strategic plan. Reporting to the Director of Finance and partnering with the Business unit leaders, you will build ground up our FP&A department. You will see the big picture and help leaders frame our long term strategy, but at the same time you need to be obsessed with details and capture the nuances behind the numbers. As part of your toolkit, you will define our budgeting & forecasting plans as well as our management reporting standards. You understand business and analytics deeply, have a grasp of basic accounting concepts (and keen to learn more) and are willing to get into the details (at least in the beginning while building your team) to master the operational and financial drivers involved. You are happy working with senior stakeholders and are capable of influencing them, with clear and concise messages. You are also competent in SQL (or eager to learn) and like playing with huge data sets, destiling insights and ways of thinking about the future.      BENEFITS

About Hopper  At Hopper, we’re on a mission to make booking travel faster, easier, and more transparent. We are leveraging the power that comes from combining massive amounts of data and machine learning to build the world’s fastest-growing travel app -- one that enables our customers to save money and travel more. With over $235M CAD in funding from leading investors in both Canada and the US, Hopper is primed to continue its path toward becoming the go-to way to book travel as the world continues its shift to mobile.  Recognized as the fastest-growing travel app by Forbes and one of the world’s most innovative companies by Fast Company two years in a row, Hopper has been downloaded over 40 million times and has helped travelers plan over 100 million trips and counting. The app has received high praise in the form of mobile accolades such as the Webby Award for Best Travel App of 2019, the Google Play Award for Standout Startup of 2016 and Apple’s App Store Best of 2015.  Take off with us!    Hopper is an insight driven organization, and nobody at the company is passionate about numbers like our Finance team. As an FP&A Sr Analyst/Analyst, your day-to-day job, whether it’s building financial models or performing an in-depth analysis on a trend you discovered searching in our data warehouse, will be towards helping our business leaders make sound financial decisions. You will understand our customers and business drivers deeply, enabling you to contribute to shaping our revenue growth and strategy. In Finance, we are both the forest and the leaves, meaning that you need to be obsessed with details and capture the nuances behind the numbers while always understanding the bigger picture. You are also a business driven person, not afraid of wearing the analytics and strategy hats at the same time. You are also competent in SQL (or eager to learn) and like playing with huge data sets, destiling insights and ways of thinking about the future.      BENEFITS

Description: Description  Goodfood (TSX:FOOD) is a leading online grocery service in Canada, delivering fresh meal solutions that make it easy for members from coast to coast to enjoy delicious meals at home every week. Goodfood’s mission is to make the impossible come true, from farm to kitchen, by enabling members to do their weekly meal planning and grocery shopping in minutes. Goodfood members get access to a unique selection of products online as well as exclusive pricing made possible by its world-class direct-to-consumer fulfillment eco-system. Goodfood currently has more than 270,000 active subscribers and over 2,500 dedicated and passionate employees across Canada.  As a you will be responsible for the implementation and enhancements of the D365 warehousing modules (Discovery, Analysis, Design, Configuration, Deployment and initial Post Implementation support) that drive our business processes across four nationwide manufacturing and fulfillment centers. This role will lead and/or participate in Requirements definition, Fit Gap Analysis, System Design, Configuration, Testing and Training of Microsoft Dynamics 365 warehousing functions. You will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to implement new and enhanced applications.  We are looking for someone with strong creative, technical skills who can handle multiple projects at once - executing projects from ideation through production. The ideal candidate has a track record of successful conceptualizing and designing supply chain processes that drive revenue, quality and productivity at a large scale.         Our team strives to give our members a world class customer experience. We believe in being ambassadors of the brand to make the impossible come true from farm to table!

Job Description  C2RO is all about generating actionable and accurate data and we are looking to hire a full-time Data Analysis Engineer responsible for finding trends and patterns in our data and generate insights out of raw data to make it more useful to our customers. This role not only requires a significant set of technical skills but also needs strong communication skills, and excellent analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of data while having excellent attention to detail and data consistency across the company. We are looking for a proactive, imaginative generalist that works well on a small, dynamic and agile team and will work with product engineers and product managers as well as sales and marketing to communicate business intelligence trends to our enterprise customers worldwide.    A data analysis engineer position at C2RO is tasked with managing and organizing data, while also keeping an eye out for trends or inconsistencies that will impact our business goals. It's a highly technical position, requiring experience and skills in areas like programming, mathematics and computer science. Such a person also needs soft skills to communicate data trends across our company and to help the business make use of the data it collects. Responsibilities will include:          Competitive salary, stock options, medical/dental insurance plan, and several other social benefits are offered.    C2RO is an AI enterprise software company based in Canada and was listed as 2020's most pioneering AI video analytics solution by Corporate Vision, as well as one of the most trusted retail technology providers in the world by CIO Techie magazine. It offers privacy-aware AI video analytics for physical spaces using proprietary edge-cloud AI and computer vision technologies. C2RO's flagship product, Perceive, is enabling data-driven decision making, optimization of operations, and transformation of physical facilities into safe, engaging, and immersive environments for visitors. The C2RO biometric-free solutions are built for scale and reuse existing surveillance cameras while being compliant with the most restrictive data privacy regulations in the world such as GDPR. In response to the COVID-19 global pandemic, C2RO Perceive™ has been significantly and seamlessly extended to include automated thermal screening and safety measures monitoring. This new analysis capability will enable real-time screening and large-scale state-wide data collection in both public and private sector applications.    Please only apply via this link ( by submitting your resume and a brief cover letter as to why this opportunity is a good fit for you. Please note we only select remote applicants from Canada or the United States with a preference to applicants residing in the same time zone (Eastern GMT-5) as C2RO. In addition, our HR team will only contact candidates whose experience is a good match with our requirements.
