Post: Cúram Business Analyst - Ottawa - RedMane Technology
Description: Job Description  Cúram Business Analyst  Company Description  RedMane Canada is an application software consulting and systems integration company in Vancouver. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the Canada and the United States by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems. In particular, we are focused to helping Indigenous communities across Canada use technology to transform how they support their most vulnerable citizens.  RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.  We are a problem-solving company. Technology is just our tool.  The Role  RedMane has full-time and contract based opportunities for Cúram Business Analysts as we continue to grow our Canadian practice. As a Business Analyst you will provide system analysis, development and production support as part of a large Cúram implementation project. The Cúram Business Analyst will design functional approaches to customize functionality using the IBM Cúram Business Application Suite. The Business Analyst is also a lead team member in the planning and execution of testing, training, support of user testing and customer support post implementation.      All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these skills:  Travel Requirements  The position offers the opportunity to travel, averaging from 35% to 55%. Project travel will vary throughout the project life cycle, being higher in the design and final testing and implementation phases. The position is based at our office in Chicago and our projects are located throughout the United States, and the Caribbean.  We Offer You  RedMane has a great working environment, offering challenging and interesting work, a place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. A chance to make a significant contribution that will be recognized and valued. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm.  We believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen.    Curam

Description: WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.  We have over 48,000 team members across the globe. In Canada, our 8,000+ people are involved in everything from environmental remediation to urban planning, from engineering iconic buildings to designing sustainable transportation networks, from finding new ways to extract essential resources to developing renewable power sources for the future.  The excellence we bring to our work and to our workplace has been recognized far and wide. We’re among the LinkedIn Top 25 Companies two years in a row, one of the Top 100 Sustainable Companies in the World (and among the Top 10 in Canada), and we earned Platinum Elite Recognition through our participation in more than half of Canada's Top 100 Infrastructure Projects .      WSP is currently seeking for hands-on Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Business Intelligence and Data Integration team. Reporting to the Business Intelligence Lead the BI Analyst will be responsible to determine business needs, to create and support Power BI dashboards, reports, datasets and dataflows; to develop and maintain BI solutions to deliver high quality data to our users; to export data in various formats for internal and external purposes. The position is located in Quebec (Montreal) or Ontario (Thornhill).      Offers of employment for safety-sensitive positions involving fieldwork are contingent upon candidates being able to perform key physical tasks of the job as described in the job posting and interview. This may include the ability to work in a variety of environmental conditions, such as remote or isolated areas, working alone, and in inclement weather (within safe and reasonable limits).  WSP welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.  WSP is committed to the principles of employment equity. Only the candidates selected will be contacted.  WSP does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. Post: R&D Business Analyst / Analyste d’Affaire R et D
Description: We’re growing and our R&D department is looking for a creative and talented Business Analyst to join the team .  You are our ideal candidate if you have strong analytical skills, great abilities to develop solid relationships with business and technical stakeholders as well as the ability to balance business requirements with technical feasibility and sustainability. But first, a little about us....  Who are we?  Tecsys is a team of 500+ plus dynamic individuals who care about a job well done. We set ourselves apart in our commitment to the health industry by helping to develop and optimize pertinent logistics methods. Our people work in a test-driven environment where we spare no effort to deliver quality, reliability and performance. We’re also a growing company attuned to new trends and practices. All that's missing is you.  Your responsibilities  In this position, you will partner with seasoned business analysts as well as development teams to craft highly scalable, flexible and resilient Elite Series logistics and warehousing solutions . You will ensure a clearly defined data and API strategy is in place. You will gather review, validate and document business and functional requirements. You will assist development and deployment teams in the end-to-end business process testing. You will work closely with the different stakeholders to ensure our strategy is well understood and is grounded with our clients reality.  Are you up for the challenge?       What else could give you an edge when applying?      Could this be the life-changing, skill and career building opportunity you've been waiting for? Don't be left wondering about what could have been. This is a growth-oriented position in an elite organization that respects and values key contributors. Act now and submit your resume.    Nous sommes en pleine croissance, et notre service de R&D cherche d’un An a lyste d’Affaire créatif et talentueux pour notre équipe .  Vous êtes un candidat idéal pour nous si vous avez de fortes aptitudes analytiques, une grande habileté à établir de solides relations avec des intervenants commerciaux et techniques ainsi que la capacité à équilibrer la faisabilité et la viabilité techniques. Mais avant, présentons-nous....  À propos de nous  Tecsys est une équipe de plus de +500 employés dynamiques qui ont le souci du travail bien fait. Tecsys se démarque par son engagement à l’égard du secteur de la santé, en contribuant à l’élaboration et à l’optimisation de méthodes logistiques pertinentes. Notre personnel travaille dans un environnement axé sur les mises à l’essai, où nous ne ménageons pas les efforts pour fournir des produits de qualité, fiables et rentables. Tecsys est également une entreprise en croissance qui s’adapte aux nouvelles tendances et pratiques. Il ne manque plus que vous.  Vos responsabilités  Dans le cadre de ce poste, vous travaillerez en partenariat avec des analystes d’affaires ainsi qu’avec des équipes de développement d’expérience pour mettre au point des solutions de logistique et d’entrepôt Elite Series dotées d’une grande évolutivité, souplesse et résilience. Vous vous assurerez qu’une stratégie API et des données clairement définies sont en place. Vous rassemblerez, examinerez, validerez et documenterez les exigences commerciales et fonctionnelles. Vous aiderez les équipes de développement et de déploiement dans le processus intégral d’analyse. Vous collaborerez étroitement avec différents intervenants pour garantir que notre stratégie est bien comprise et qu’elle correspond bien à la réalité de nos clients.  Êtes-vous prêt à relever le défi?       Qu’est-ce qui pourrait être un atout quand vous postulerez?  D’autres excellentes raisons de vous joindre à TECSYS  Serait-ce l’occasion tant attendue pour vous d’effectuer un changement majeur, de perfectionner vos compétences et de faire avancer vos possibilités de carrière? Ne soyez pas de ceux qui s’interrogeront sur ce qui aurait pu arriver. Cette offre d’emploi est axée sur la croissance au sein d’une entreprise d’élite qui respecte et valorise les contributeurs clés. Passez à l’action maintenant et soumettez votre CV.

Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.     One of the key objectives of PMO, CLO is to manage our Company’s COVID-19 oversight program, which will include interacting with key business stakeholders, human resources, facilities, safety and security, and the broader legal and corporate development function.       We are looking for an individual who has strong cross-functional communication skills, excellent analytical and problem solving skills, with experience in crisis management or business continuity.  It is your job to help manage our pandemic response and recovery program through attaining and maintaining a thorough understanding of OpenText’s business operations and locations, working closely with stakeholders including our senior management, local site leadership, and local emergency response teams to support a safe and healthy work environment for our more than 60 physical locations around the world. You’ll also interact with our business operations, Corporate Business Continuity team, HR, Facilities, Communications, and other cross-functional stakeholders. Description: With operations in 35+ nations and ~ 27,000 employees worldwide, CSL is driven to develop and deliver a broad range of lifesaving therapies to treat disorders such as hemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza. CSL Behring is a global leader in the protein biotherapeutics industry, focused on bringing to market biotherapies used to treat serious and often rare conditions. Seqirus is the second largest influenza vaccine company in the world and is a transcontinental partner in pandemic preparedness and a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally. Description: Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.    Do you have a passion for analyzing, solving problems and quality? Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference and a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations. We are striving to create leading web and mobile experiences that enables our customers to choose how, when and where they want to engage with their financial services.  We are looking for a highly motivated that will analyze and implement product calculation engines that support a variety of Insurance products. You will work on a dynamic team to produce calculation engines for a suite of applications within an agile environment. If you have actuarial or mathematical skills and are open to work in a collaborative environment, we would like to talk to you.  In this position, you will be involved with the following:             Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of March 31, 2020, we had $1.2 trillion (US$0.8 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $30.4 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.  Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention and advancement and we administer all of our practices and programs based on qualification and performance and without discrimination on any protected ground. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request any accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Overview  We are seeking a results-driven, entrepreneurial Financial Analyst, Corporate Development who is responsible for performing financial, valuation and business analysis to support the Company's business and corporate development initiatives. This position provides the strategic rationale and project planning support necessary to achieve alignment between market opportunities and the priorities guided by the leadership team and overall objectives of the Company. Reporting to the Chief Revenue Officer, the Financial Analyst works closely with key internal stakeholders across multiple business units, including members of the senior leadership team. This position will provide continuous professional development and corporate advancements within the Company. The successful candidate will work remotely based in Vancouver, BC.    To accelerate organizational growth through performance of complex financial analyses & modelling and strategic advisory.              Terramera is a cleantech leader focused on fusing AI, science and nature to create revolutionary technologies that transform how we grow food and solve other world-scale challenges. With its Actigate™ Targeted Performance technology and mission to unlock the intelligence in nature to ensure a world that thrives and provides for everyone, Terramera is committed to reducing global synthetic chemical loads in agriculture by 80 percent while increasing global farm productivity by 20 percent by 2030. The privately held company was founded in 2010 and has grown to include a world-class bench of engineers, scientists, advisors and investors. Terramera is headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, has integrated operations that include research labs, robotics workshop, greenhouse and farm, and has more than 200 patents in its IP portfolio.  Our success begins with our people. We're looking for A-Players who are passionate about making a difference as we are and thrive in environments that are dynamic, challenging and rewarding. Join our movement, as we set a new standard and change the world together as a highly dedicated, innovative, future-focused and solutions-oriented team.  Terramera offers a generous compensation package covering competitive base salary, unlimited paid vacation, options, bonus plan, extended health benefits, paid professional development activities, home office equipment, and other attractive elements.  While we thank all applicants for their interest, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. For more information on Terramera, please visit our website at www.terramera.com

Challenge  It's in your nature to be the inquisitive type: always asking the questions everyone else is afraid to find the answers to. Luckily for our Toronto-based PE & VC client, you're not the type to shy away from asking the hard questions, finding the necessary clues, and getting your answers. As the Senior Analyst, you will be reporting directly to the Manager, Investment Finance, and become responsible for the accounting and reporting function, as well as providing transaction support and analytics. You will be working on an assigned portfolio, where you will ensure the completeness and accuracy of financial records for all investments: this is where your inquisitive nature comes into play. This role requires you to prepare and review quarterly/annual legal entity financial statements in accordance with appropriate accounting standards. You will use your 5+ years of relevant experience, especially with IFRS, private equity alongside other members within the Finance, Tax, and Legal and Deal teams. If you're the inquisitor with a mind for analysis and seeking answers, then apply today!    Financial Reporting & Analytics  Supports the Deal Team on various financial reporting and analytics for the Ventures and Growth Equity investment portfolios; Analyzes and provides performance return information (e.g. IRR, total return, etc) for the full portfolio and by segments, and prepares various management reports; Prepares/reviews quarterly and/or annual legal entity financial statements including notes and audit working papers in accordance with the appropriate accounting standards, as well as corresponding tax kits.  Fund Administration & Investor Reporting  Prepares quarterly and/or annual investor reporting in respect of internally managed venture capital funds, including applicable financial performance metrics. Respond to investor queries and requests as applicable.  Stakeholder Management & Oversight of Junior team members  Collaboration with many different departments and key stakeholders including; Deals team, portfolio companies, reporting, etc. You will also be responsible for managing a rotating co-op student program.

Challenge  It's in your nature to be the inquisitive type: always asking the questions everyone else is afraid to find the answers to. Luckily for our Toronto-based PE & VC client, you're not the type to shy away from asking the hard questions, finding the necessary clues, and getting your answers. As the Senior Analyst, you will be reporting directly to the Manager, Investment Finance, and become responsible for the accounting and reporting function, as well as providing transaction support and analytics. You will be working on an assigned portfolio, where you will ensure the completeness and accuracy of financial records for all investments: this is where your inquisitive nature comes into play. This role requires you to prepare and review quarterly/annual legal entity financial statements in accordance with appropriate accounting standards. You will use your 5+ years of relevant experience, especially with IFRS, private equity alongside other members within the Finance, Tax, and Legal and Deal teams. If you're the inquisitor with a mind for analysis and seeking answers, then apply today!    Financial Reporting & Analytics  Supports the Deal Team on various financial reporting and analytics for the Ventures and Growth Equity investment portfolios; Analyzes and provides performance return information (e.g. IRR, total return, etc) for the full portfolio and by segments, and prepares various management reports; Prepares/reviews quarterly and/or annual legal entity financial statements including notes and audit working papers in accordance with the appropriate accounting standards, as well as corresponding tax kits.  Fund Administration & Investor Reporting  Prepares quarterly and/or annual investor reporting in respect of internally managed venture capital funds, including applicable financial performance metrics. Respond to investor queries and requests as applicable.  Stakeholder Management & Oversight of Junior team members  Collaboration with many different departments and key stakeholders including; Deals team, portfolio companies, reporting, etc. You will also be responsible for managing a rotating co-op student program.

Post: Intern, Digital Data Analyst (Summer 2021) - Location Flexible
Description: Company Description Dropbox is now a Virtual First company, which means work outside of an office will be the primary experience for all employees. Being Virtual First also means the location of our employees is targeted but flexible. If “Location Flexible” is listed in the job title of a role, the role can be located in any of the states where Dropbox is authorized to do business.** Some roles (including those which do not have “Location Flexible” in the job title), however, may have to be co-located with their teams in certain locations. Please work with your recruiter and your hiring manager to understand any location constraints of a particular role and to communicate your location preferences.  **Dropbox is authorized to do business in many, but not all, states. If you are not located in or able to work from a state where Dropbox is registered, you will not be eligible for employment. Please speak with your recruiter to learn more about where Dropbox is registered.   Dropbox is one place to keep life organized and keep work moving. With more than 600 million registered users across 180 countries, we’re on a mission to design a more enlightened way of working. Dropbox is headquartered in San Francisco, CA, and has offices around the world. For more information on our mission and products, visit dropbox.com.

Description: Pets are our passion, safety is our promise and progress is our pledge. We work smarter, not harder. As a result, we’re widely known as a ‘Best Place to Work’. We make some of the world's most popular and trusted food brands and are committed to advancing the science, health and food products for pets.    Business areas: Nestlé Purina PetCare Canada Job title: Shopper Insights Analyst Location: Mississauga, Ontario Department: Marketing Development Organization (MDO)    We are looking for a based at our Nestle Purina PetCare Canada location in Mississauga, Ontario reporting into the Senior Shopper Insights Manager. This position is responsible for analyzing statistical market and shopper data to identify business issues and opportunities, and provide recommendations and insight for the Sales, Marketing and Category Development teams.    As a Shopper Insights analyst, you will be accountable for managing Nielsen data and internal databases ensuring the integrity of the data. You will develop a loyalty data strategy to deliver insights to the organization from Customer Loyalty systems and develop a POS and Data strategy to build efficiency and effectiveness with our data across the organization. You will be responsible for leading the 3rd party information partnership and participate in the development and implementation of 4P Plans for the MDO team as well as the development and implementation of Integrated Commercial Business Planning (ICBP) for major accounts.      As the successful candidate, you will be a self-starter and have excellent interpersonal skills, strategic business skills and time management skills. You will have proven problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to gain insights and develop recommendations. You will have strong knowledge of multiple insights tools and processes, both qualitative and quantitative. You will need to be results focused, detail oriented and thrive in a fast-paced environment managing several complex priorities with strict deadlines. You are required to have exceptional communication and presentation skills including the ability to explain difficult concepts and insights in simple, applicable business terms and have the ability to influence your target business audience.    We have a friendly, supportive team with a coaching and mentoring environment. There are real opportunities for future development and progression – this really could be a move towards the exciting career you’ve always wanted.  Nestlé is 308,000 employees strong and are driven by the purpose of enhancing the quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. With more than CHF 91.4 billion sales in 2018, we have an expansive presence with 413 factories in more than 85 countries. We believe our people are our most important asset, so we'll offer you a dynamic international working environment with constant opportunities for development. Want to learn more? Visit us at .

Nestlé Purina PetCare Canada are a leader in the pet care industry, whose vision is to be the world’s most trusted Company in Enriching the Lives of Pets and the People Who Love Them. We are high performers who thrive among the best and offer a dynamic and collaborative work environment where you can contribute to challenging, satisfying and meaningful work. We are committed to building a team that is committed to pets and their owners. Your Pet, Our Passion®    Business areas: Nestlé Purina PetCare Canada Job title: Business Analyst, e-Commerce Location: Mississauga, ON Job Grade: 15    We are looking for a based at our PetCare Division in Mississauga, Ontario reporting into the Director, e-Commerce. This position is responsible for supporting the day-to-day customer management of Purina’s e-Commerce business with key online retailers. This is a data driven and analytical role that utilizes the strong communication and investigative skills to recommend positive changes in the way we approach our business. The successful candidate will make fact-based recommendations to help the account team deliver success against our Key Performance Indicators and optimize the business.    As a , you will be responsible for all e-Comm sales and marketing-related reporting and analytics.      As the successful candidate, you will have excellent interpersonal skills coupled with experience working cross-functionally with many departments. You will need to be passionate, results focused, detail oriented and enjoy working in a highly analytical and numbers driven position. You will already have great analytical and problem-solving skills coupled with your ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced environment. You will have strong communication skills and expertise presenting to both small and large groups. You will also:  We have a friendly, supportive team with a coaching and mentoring environment. There are real opportunities for future development and progression – this really could be a move towards the exciting sales career you’ve always wanted.    What can we offer in return? Great benefits you’d expect from a business the size of Nestle including a comprehensive total rewards benefits package including Health and Dental benefits that start on day one as well as a Company matched retirement savings plan, Excellent training and development programs as well as opportunities to grow within the company.  The closing date for applications is . We will be considering applicants as they apply, so please don’t delay in submitting your application.  Nestlé is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. If you are selected to participate in the recruitment process, please inform Human Resources of any accommodations you may require. Nestlé will work with you in an effort to ensure that you are able to fully participate in the process.

Description: Background  Agility PR Solutions provides powerful yet intuitive media outreach, monitoring, and measurement solutions for tomorrow’s communicators. Since 2003, clients have trusted our tools and services to help them discover and connect with journalists, amplify the impact of their messages, monitor media coverage, and measure the impact of their public relations efforts. Our patented monitoring technology and team of media analysts help organizations glean the insights that help them to flourish.  We have staff around the globe including the United States, the Philippines, offices in the United Kingdom, and Headquarters in the beautiful Canadian capital city of Ottawa.    Reporting to the Manager, Data Analytics & Media Intelligence, the plays a significant role in preparing media analysis reports, including gathering requirements, conceptualizing, implementing, and delivering the final product. The Senior Media Analyst’s tasks include: monitoring media from various sources (print, online, broadcast, social, etc.) using proprietary software; judging the relevance of the content in the context of client business and directives; being able to connect the social and traditional media metrics to overall company goals.  This role requires collaboration with a variety of departments and team members, both locally and overseas. The Senior Analyst will help ensure a high standard of quality by reviewing work from other team members, project managing from report conceptualization to delivery of product that is executive-ready standard, and offering feedback and guidance to help elevate other team members.  The successful candidate must be flexible, with an aptitude for quantitative and qualitative analysis, strong writing and editing skills, data visualization smarts, and an in‐depth knowledge of web analytics, social media analytics, and media measurement. We are looking for someone with a strong eye for detail, strong organizational and time management abilities, and a passion for news and social media. This full‐time position would be ideal for a well‐rounded and experienced candidate who loves digging into data and using words and visuals to tell the story behind the numbers.     Application deadline: Wednesday, November 25
Industry: Marketing and AdvertisingPublic Relations and CommunicationsComputer Software

Description: This is your opportunity to join AXIS Capital – a trusted global provider of specialty lines insurance and reinsurance. We stand apart for our outstanding client service, intelligent risk taking and superior risk adjusted returns for our shareholders. We also proudly maintain an entrepreneurial, disciplined and ethical corporate culture. As a member of AXIS, you join a team that is among the best in the industry.  The Lead Data Analyst for Future Insurance Platform Data Integration is the senior most member of the development team responsible for translating business requirements into pragmatic and functional application/technology solutions. The primary responsibility of this individual is to act as the steward of the FIP Data Dictionary, grow into the expert of data and functional data transformations across components of the solution (subject areas of customer, broker, submission, quote, policy transactions, billing, claims), lead the requirements, design, and implementation of data as it is passed to other corporate consumers, and drive the development team toward quality delivery. Strong knowledge of the insurance domain from a data perspective, experience in data dictionary maintenance / data lineage maintenance is required. Knowledge and expertise in Duck Creek Policy and Claims Manuscript/ Console configuration, XSLT transforms, SQL Business Intelligence/Database queries and stored procedures is preferred. Knowledge in Duck Creek Data Insights is a plus. A successful candidate will combine hands on functional/technical skills with the ability to develop solutions and mentor a technical delivery teams.

The Poshmark data analytics team is looking for a Sr. Data Analyst for their growing International businesses outside the US. This position will be key to drive insights and help make business decisions as we grow globally. You will have a unique opportunity to work with a fast growing international team to proactively identify and drive new data initiatives that will ultimately help grow Poshmark across the globe. This person will be focussed on providing analytics support and data insights to various international teams (currently just Canada and more very soon..)             Poshmark is a leading social commerce platform for the next generation of retailers and shoppers. Through technology, our mission is to build the world’s most connected shopping experience, while empowering people to build thriving retail businesses. Since launching in 2011, Poshmark has become a vibrant social shopping community with seven million Seller Stylists helping 60 million users discover items they love from over 100 million listings. The company is backed by the world’s leading investment firms including Mayfield, Menlo Ventures, GGV Capital, Temasek, Inventus Capital, Uncork Capital, Union Grove Venture Partners, Shea Ventures and AngelList. For more information, please visit www.poshmark.com, or find us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest and YouTube.    At Poshmark, we’re constantly challenging the status quo and are looking for innovative and passionate people to help shape the future of Poshmark. We’re disrupting the industry by combining social connections with e-commerce through data-driven solutions and the latest technology to optimize our platform. We’re nothing without our amazing team who deliver an unparalleled social shopping experience to the millions of people we connect each day.  We built Poshmark around four core values: 1) focus on people to create empowered communities that drive success; 2) together we grow to support each other to strive for our dreams; 3) lead with love to foster genuine connections built upon a foundation of respect; and 4) embrace your weirdness to accept and empower one another on their own unique journey. We’re invested in our team and community, working together to build an entirely new way to shop. That way, when we win, we all win together. Come help us build the most connected shopping experience ever.    Poshmark is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Description: Description  Titre du poste : Analyste principal(e), gestion des technologies utilisateurs  Lieu : Montréal  Se rapporte à : Gestionnaire, prestation de services O365 et EUC  Domtar est un important fournisseur d'une grande variété de produits à base de fibre, dont des papiers de communication, de spécialité et d’emballage, de la pâte commerciale ainsi que des produits hygiéniques absorbants. Comptant près de 10 000 employés au service de clients dans plus de 50 pays, Domtar est animée par la volonté de transformer la fibre de bois durable en produits utiles sur lesquels les gens peuvent compter au quotidien.  Le Service des technologies utilisateurs a pour mission de gérer et de développer efficacement les technologies de Domtar qui touchent les utilisateurs finals et la relation entre l’utilisateur final et le système informatique principal. Ce groupe s’emploie à fournir du travail de la plus haute qualité pour répondre aux besoins de ses clients, tout en tenant compte de la sécurité et la stabilité de l’environnement, des coûts d’exploitation minimums et du temps de disponibilité.  Relevant du responsable de la prestation de services O365 et EUC, votre principal mandat en tant qu’analyste principal, gestion des technologies utilisateurs sera d’assurer l’évolution et les changements technologiques qui surviennent dans votre sphère d’expertise par l’intermédiaire d’un projet ou en gérant de façon proactive les solutions existantes et en identifiant les besoins qui s’imposent.             Compétences techniques :      Vous devez réussir un processus de sélection qui comprend des entrevues, des tests d’aptitudes (selon le poste) et une prise de références. Global Financial Firm located in MISSISSAUGA, ON has an immediate contract opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst- Analyst  "This role is currently work-from-home and will move to the office environment after the COVID-19 restrictions are lifted. must have reliable internet, computer and android or iphone for remote access    Junior Business and Data Analyst will be performing analysis across several lines of business in the Investment Bank covering key regulatory initiatives. The candidate will be responsible for gathering the requirements for several lines of business regarding data flow mapping from internal to the external venues, access and backstop controls. Successful candidate will need to have strong analytical and problem solving skills, ability to document existing systems and processes into business requirements documents. Ability to do data analysis, including data flow, business rules, and use cases/stories. She/he will be working closely with senior business users; coordinating meetings with business and technology groups. Client management is an integral part of the role, and as such the successful candidate will be responsible for project governance, including managing user groups and communicating status to senior technology and business sponsors. Excellent verbal and written communication will be essential for effectiveness in this role. Develop relationships across the organization to know whose input is needed and when. Assess the impact of changes on existing business and technology process, as well as other interfacing systems. Become a subject matter expert to guide technology and support teams to resolve questions on the requirements and business purpose underlying them. Identify gaps in data and answer questions for either new requirements or ongoing support purposes. Work with geographically dispersed teams. " Previous PM / BA experience within technology organization is a plus.

# Research Analyst I - Toronto, Ontario  JOB POSTING # 866418  Position: Research Analyst I  Princess Margaret Research Institute  Cancer Genomics Program  Manager  $24.61 - $30.76 per hour (Commensurate with experience and consistent with UHN Compensation Policy)  35 hours per week  Temporary Full-Time  is looking for an experienced professional to fill the key role of at the Cancer Genomics Program.    The University Health Network, where , encompasses . The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of groundbreaking firsts and a purpose of , the University Health Network (UHN), Canada's largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.  University Health Network (UHN) is a research hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto and a member of the Toronto Academic Health Science Network. The scope of research and complexity of cases at UHN have made it a national and international source for discovery, education and patient care. Research across UHN's five research institutes spans the full spectrum of diseases and disciplines, including cancer, cardiovascular sciences, transplantation, neural and sensory sciences, musculoskeletal health, rehabilitation sciences, and community and population health. Find out about our purpose, values and principles here at http://www.uhn.ca/corporate/AboutUHN/Purposevalues_principles.aspx .  The Cancer Program at the Princess Margaret Cancer Centre is the largest of its kind in Canada, providing more patient visits and involving more cancer doctors and specialists than any other oncology centre in Canada. The Princess Margaret Cancer Program has embarked on a new Personalized Cancer Medicine initiative-a multi-faceted, integrated approach aimed at giving the right treatment for the right patient at the right time. Due to rapid expansion, there is a need for a new Research Analyst I.  The Research Analyst participates in the collection of clinical research data for studies in support of the centre's Cancer Genomics initiatives. Principal responsibilities include reviewing medical charts for relevant information, recording clinical research data in electronic case report forms (eCRFs), and ensuring the quality and integrity of data collected. The coordination of data is performed in accordance with the study protocol, hospital and departmental guidelines, and professional standards of practice. All data must be completed in an accurate and timely manner and must be in compliance with applicable ICH-GCP, Tri-Council, and federal regulations. The Research Analyst must be able to interpret the applicable regulations in order to ensure compliance. Quality assurance procedures are utilized to ensure high quality data is obtained. The Research Analyst also undertakes study-related administrative tasks such as organizing meetings, taking minutes, obtaining signatures, and helping to prepare submissions to and track approvals from the Research Ethics Board.    For current UHN employees, only those who have successfully completed their probationary period, have a good employee record along with satisfactory attendance in accordance with UHN's attendance management program, and possess all the required experience and qualifications should apply.  November 5, 2020 ENDING DATE: Until filled  University Health Network thanks all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  UHN is a respectful, caring, and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the Bona-fide requirements for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.

Company Name: Societe Generale Corporate and Investment Banking - SGCIB
Description: Responsibilities  The RISQ Division's mission is to contribute, through its expertise, understanding of risks, risk management techniques, and by providing effective challenge to the business lines, to the sustainable and predictable growth of the SG Group.  RISQ Americas is looking to build out an inhouse data quality capability and is looking to hire Analyst or Associate Level Junior Data Management Analyst (“DMA”) to ensure compliance with BCBS 239 for RISQ Americas. The DMA will support Data Domain Owners and Subject-Matter Experts across RISQ Americas and Head office in all phases of BCBS239 data management program with partnership with Americas Regional Data Management Office (RDMO), RISQ Data Management Office and IT departments (GBSU and BSC).  In particular, the DMA will directly support RISQ Americas Data Domain Owner and RISQ Data Stewards in the annual certification process of Critical Data Elements (CDEs) by assessing business metadata, data lineage and associated data quality controls and teir automation. Where required, the DMA will perform additional data lineage and update meta data.  RISQ DMA is an evolving role and is expected to contribute to the global RISQ data management strategy by collaborating with technology, operations, and other cross-organizational control functions.  The Junior DMA position will require quantitative and technical skills for data reporting and analysis.  Prior involvement project management from user’s perspective, especially innovation projects, preferred. Knowledge of data management main principles and regulations is a plus. Strong appetite to learn Credit Risk, use Referential Data, IT architecture.             Did you know?        A career within the Societe Generale Group is an opportunity to participate in a team effort to build the bank of tomorrow.  Together, let's be the future:     Are you interested in knowing more? Click here to find out.    Societe Generale opened its Canadian headquarters in Montreal in 1974 to offer its financial services to corporations, financial institutions and governments. The Toronto and Calgary offices were opened in 1978 and 2006 respectively.  We now employ over four hundred people, both in the traditional banking sector (investment banking, funds and trading activities) and in the field of information technology, with the opening of our SG Montreal Solutions Centre subsidiary which, thanks to its geographical location and its cultural diversity, provides computer support and development for the New York and Paris teams.  Get on board and get involved! We are here to support you !

Information Business Analyst  Position Description CGI is offering an exciting opportunity as an information Business Analyst in a digital environment. As a member of CGI’s national practice providing retail banking solutions and services to credit unions, you will be joining an experienced and dynamic team of global IT professionals serving our clients across Canada and the world.  The financial industry is in the midst of dramatic change and credit unions are challenged with finding faster, more innovative ways of providing solutions and services to their customers who have more alternatives than ever before. Digital transformation and digital services are disrupting traditional financial institutions, instead offering businesses and households access to services that are customized specifically to personalized needs and wants of the end consumer. Omni-channel experience, mobile self-service, predictive analytics, data governance, robotic process automation, FinTech partnerships, and open banking requirements have turned the banking industry on its head. Staying relevant is key while customer retention and growth has never been more challenging. Our clients are turning to CGI to help them remodel their operations and assist in navigating through the massive digital transformational changes required to remain competitive.              Your future duties and responsibilities      It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

TD Description  Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.  Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com    What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.  The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.  This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.  Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.    Are you a big picture thinker? Fantastic! This is exactly the kind of thinking TD needs when it comes to our business intelligence support and analytics. In this role, we need you to take a holistic, high level approach to collection and reporting of data for major projects and initiatives across TD.  As data's role in providing extraordinary products and services to our customers grows, we'll look to the valued expertise you'll provide in this role, to develop, adopt and evolve the best in class reporting and business intelligence capability.  Does this sound like you? You're a natural leader, and can lead major initiatives and projects, joining business owners and partners to determine business needs and recommend solutions. Moreover, you have a talent for looking at a collection of data and drawing rare insights. In this role, we'll need you to include those insights and commentary within the existing reporting packages you deliver. Finally, you'll fit in well if you like to own your space and execute with speed and precision, relishing all challenges as opportunities to dig in, collaborate and take TD into the future of banking.   <u;> `</u;>    Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:    At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported.
